title: Former World Boxing Champion Ricky Hatton Dies at 46
snippets: BBC Sport's Joe Lynskey looks back at the boxing career of former world champion Ricky Hatton, who has died at the age of 46.

Former world boxing champion Ricky Hatton has died at the age of 46. Hatton won world titles at light welterweight and welterweight with an all-action style made him one of the most popular fighters of his era.
The British authorities said that the boxer, who retired in 2012, was found unresponsive at a home in Greater Manchester.

Hatton, known throughout his career as the Hitman, was one of the best-known British fighters of his generation

Tributes have been paid to the British former world boxing champion Ricky Hatton who has been found dead at his home at the age of 46.

Hatton, known throughout his career as
Ricky Hatton has died aged 46.
Ricky Hatton, the¬†former world boxing champion¬†who rose to become one of the most popular fighters in the sport, has died. He was 46.
titles: The world of boxing remembers legend Hatton
Former boxing world champion Hatton dies at 46
Ricky Hatton, British Boxer and Former World Champion, Is Dead
Ricky Hatton, former boxing world champion, dies aged 46
Ricky Hatton dies aged 46
Ricky Hatton, former world boxing champion, dies at 46
summary: Former world boxing champion Ricky Hatton has passed away at the age of 46. Known for his all-action style and success in the light welterweight and welterweight divisions, Hatton was a celebrated figure in British boxing. He was found unresponsive at a residence in Greater Manchester. Hatton, nicknamed the Hitman, retired in 2012 and leaves behind a legacy as one of the most beloved British fighters of his generation. Tributes from the boxing community and fans are pouring in to honor his memory.

They aim to prevent tariffs set for November. The US has extended TikTok's deadline to find a non-Chinese buyer to September 17, to avoid a ban.

summary: Lough Neagh, the UK and Ireland's largest lake, is experiencing its third consecutive year of toxic blue-green algae blooms, caused by pollution from over-farming. Despite signs promoting it as a natural paradise, the lake is now choked with algae that resembles pea soup and emits a rotten egg smell, impacting its status as a picturesque boating and tourist destination.

title: Solar Flares Far Hotter, Habitable Zone Larger Than Thought: Study
